title: College Prep Test Scores
question_text:
Suppose $500$ females at a local high school took a college prep test this year. Below is the five-number summary of their scores:
  • Minimum: $14$
  • First quartile: $16$
  • Median: $21$
  • Third quartile: $28$
  • Maximum: $36$
Which of the following statements is true?

choices.text:
About
250
females at this high school scored greater than
28
.
This is a fairly symmetric distribution.

The student who scored
36
is obviously an outlier.
